author: 0xunclebill
content: The transactions in the Inclusion generated in slot n-1 are required to be included in block N. A builder building a block without including those txs is effectively producing an invalid payload

author: potuz
content: The point he's making is that a builder can fill their block with any tx to not include the FOCIL txs, yes, this is doable but not for long.

author: pellekrab
content: What is the "not for long" solution you are referring to?

author: potuz
content: Filling the block increases the gas price. Filling the next one will be more expensive. And the censored tx will be included again in the IL

author: pellekrab
content: Oh ok, that makes a lot more sense now, I didn't think about that. Are there any estimates on how many blocks it would take to make a censored FOCIL block unprofitable? I am assuming it would be pretty quick.

author: potuz
content: It's a bit tricky cause it's not exponential and it depends if the censored party is willing to raise the price or not. The most serious study about this I know is from <@1093576549594308778> he can point to the article

author: sky.cactus
content: It is immediately unprofitable to block stuff.

author: sky.cactus
content: It gets more and more expensive the longer you do it, but it is never "profitable".

author: sky.cactus
content: In the average case, the cost to stuff the first block is `base_fee * block_gas_limit * 0.5`.  Stuffing the next block (in the average case) would cost `1/8` more, the next `1/8` more than that, etc.

author: sky.cactus
content: Cost to stuff doubles about every 6 blocks (72 seconds).
